name: df-cytp
body: |- wceq(ccytp, cmpt(s0, cn, co(cfv(cmgp, cfv(cpl1, ccnfld)), cgsu, cmpt(s1, cima(ccnv(cfv(cod, co(cfv(cmgp, ccnfld), cress, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))))), csn(cv(s0))), co(cfv(cv1, ccnfld), cfv(csg, cfv(cpl1, ccnfld)), cfv(cfv(cascl, cfv(cpl1, ccnfld)), cv(s1)))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ CytP =(s0 ∈ ℕ ↦((mulGrp `(Poly1 ` CCfld))[gsum](s1 ∈(`'(od `((mulGrp ` CCfld)[|`s](ℂ \ { 0 })))" { s0 })↦((var1 ` CCfld)[(-g `(Poly1 ` CCfld))]((algSc `(Poly1 ` CCfld))` s1)))))
comment: The Nth _cyclotomic polynomial_ is the polynomial which has as its zeros precisely the primitive Nth roots of unity. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 5-Sep-2015.)
